flavor: In dark times, Truth bears a blade.

text:
Flying

Put two 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.

name: Endless Horizons
text:
When Endless Horizons enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Plains cards and exile them. Then shuffle your library.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a card you own exiled with Endless Horizons into your hand.

flavor: The Aurora had lessened the kithkins' kindness, deepened their paranoia, and dulled their sense of pain.

flavor: Its wings disturb more than air.

text:
Flying
When Flickerwisp enters the battlefield, exile another target permanent. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

flavor:
"I'd rather hear the screams of battle than the quiet that follows."
—Talara, elvish safewright

Flying

flavor:
"Muscle does not make one strong. It only masks the soul's light. True strength lies in purity of purpose."
—Donal Alloway, cenn of Kinscaer
name: Light from Within
text: Chroma — Each creature you control gets +1/+1 for each white mana symbol in its mana cost.

flavor: It's tethered not to keep it from fleeing but to keep it from eating everything in sight.

Defender, flying
Whenever you cast a white spell, Loyal Gyrfalcon loses defender until end of turn.

Enchant creature

Flying

Flying

{U/R}{U/R}{U/R}{U/R}: You may put a blue or red creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

flavor: Even treefolk witches steer clear of the unpredictable woods near Glen Elendra. Spells refract off the glamer-polished trees and the eyes of lurking pucas.
name: Mirror Sheen
text: {1}{U/R}{U/R}: Copy target instant or sorcery spell that targets you. You may choose new targets for the copy.
title: Mirror Sheen

flavor: Noggles believe that they were the first race ever to walk Shadowmoor. They don't "steal." They just take back what's rightfully theirs.
name: Noggle Bandit
text: Noggle Bandit can't be blocked except by creatures with defender.
title: Noggle Bandit

flavor: "It's always funny till someone gets hurt. Then it's hilarious."
name: Noggle Bridgebreaker
text: When Noggle Bridgebreaker enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
title: Noggle Bridgebreaker

name: Noggle Hedge-Mage
text:
When Noggle Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Islands, you may tap two target permanents.
When Noggle Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Mountains, you may have Noggle Hedge-Mage deal 2 damage to target player.
title: Noggle Hedge-Mage

flavor: Noggles live purely by what they can scavenge. There is not a single thing a noggle eats, wears, or uses that did not once belong to another.
name: Noggle Ransacker
text: When Noggle Ransacker enters the battlefield, each player draws two cards, then discards a card at random.
title: Noggle Ransacker

flavor: It loathes all tastes but two: spells and flesh.
name: Nucklavee
text:
When Nucklavee enters the battlefield, you may return target red sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
When Nucklavee enters the battlefield, you may return target blue instant card from your graveyard to your hand.
title: Nucklavee

flavor: Mimics don't hide their natural form well, but their disguises work well enough on boggarts.
name: Riverfall Mimic
text: Whenever you cast a spell that's both blue and red, Riverfall Mimic has base power and toughness 3/3 until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.
title: Riverfall Mimic

name: Shrewd Hatchling
text:
Shrewd Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
{U/R}: Target creature can't block Shrewd Hatchling this turn.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Shrewd Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a red spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Shrewd Hatchling.
title: Shrewd Hatchling

flavor: Like many who dwell in Shadowmoor now, he was robbed of his better half by the Aurora.
name: Stream Hopper
text: {U/R}: Stream Hopper gains flying until end of turn.
title: Stream Hopper

flavor: The scales of battle rarely balance.
name: Unnerving Assault
text: Creatures your opponents control get -1/-0 until end of turn if {U} was spent to cast Unnerving Assault, and creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn if {R} was spent to cast it. (Do both if {U}{R} was spent.)
title: Unnerving Assault

flavor: Once the hideous disease takes hold, it spreads through both bark and mind.
name: Canker Abomination
text: As Canker Abomination enters the battlefield, choose an opponent. Canker Abomination enters the battlefield with a -1/-1 counter on it for each creature that player controls.
title: Canker Abomination

flavor: Nothing warms the bark on a chilly day like a draught of elf.
name: Cankerous Thirst
text: If {B} was spent to cast Cankerous Thirst, you may have target creature get -3/-3 until end of turn. If {G} was spent to cast Cankerous Thirst, you may have target creature get +3/+3 until end of turn. (Do both if {B}{G} was spent.)
title: Cankerous Thirst

name: Creakwood Liege
text:
Other black creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a 1/1 black and green Worm creature token onto the battlefield.
title: Creakwood Liege

flavor:
"His skin cuts swords."
—The Seer's Parables
name: Deity of Scars
text:
Trample
Deity of Scars enters the battlefield with two -1/-1 counters on it.
{B/G}, Remove a -1/-1 counter from Deity of Scars: Regenerate Deity of Scars.
title: Deity of Scars

flavor: Loose earth is not a burial but an appetizer.
name: Desecrator Hag
text: When Desecrator Hag enters the battlefield, return to your hand the creature card in your graveyard with the greatest power. If two or more cards are tied for greatest power, you choose one of them.
title: Desecrator Hag

flavor: It eats and eats until the juiciest morsel it can find is itself.
name: Doomgape
text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
title: Doomgape

flavor: Trows have learned that it's not wise to eat cinders without a bucket or two of water nearby.
name: Drain the Well
text: Destroy target land. You gain 2 life.
title: Drain the Well

name: Gift of the Deity
text:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature is black, it gets +1/+1 and has deathtouch. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy that creature.)
As long as enchanted creature is green, it gets +1/+1 and all creatures able to block it do so.
title: Gift of the Deity

name: Hag Hedge-Mage
text:
When Hag Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Swamps, you may have target player discard a card.
When Hag Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Forests, you may put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
title: Hag Hedge-Mage

name: Noxious Hatchling
text:
Noxious Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Whenever you cast a black spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Noxious Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a green spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Noxious Hatchling.
title: Noxious Hatchling

flavor: Trows are the vile trolls that lurk in the bogs of Shadowmoor. They reappear each night to frighten the living and gnaw the dead.
name: Odious Trow
text: {1}{B/G}: Regenerate Odious Trow.
title: Odious Trow

flavor: While it's true that a quillspike does heal the sick, it's just because it finds them tastier that way.
name: Quillspike
text: {B/G}, Remove a -1/-1 counter from a creature you control: Quillspike gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
title: Quillspike

name: Rendclaw Trow
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)
title: Rendclaw Trow

flavor: Her plans may yet bear fruit.
name: Sapling of Colfenor
text:
Indestructible
Whenever Sapling of Colfenor attacks, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, you gain life equal to that card's toughness, lose life equal to its power, then put it into your hand.
title: Sapling of Colfenor

flavor: Her hunt is silent until a bone snaps or flesh tears. Her victims never know to scream.
name: Stalker Hag
text: Swampwalk, forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp or a Forest.)
title: Stalker Hag

flavor: A mimic's disguise fools its victims just long enough to draw them within range of its venomous tentacles.
name: Woodlurker Mimic
text: Whenever you cast a spell that's both black and green, Woodlurker Mimic has base power and toughness 4/5 until end of turn and gains wither until end of turn. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
title: Woodlurker Mimic

name: Worm Harvest
text:
Put a 1/1 black and green Worm creature token onto the battlefield for each land card in your graveyard.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)
title: Worm Harvest

name: Balefire Liege
text:
Other red creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other white creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you cast a red spell, Balefire Liege deals 3 damage to target player.
Whenever you cast a white spell, you gain 3 life.
title: Balefire Liege

flavor: Mimics don't need perfect disguises. They need only the perfect victims: the naive, the young, or the poor of sight.
name: Battlegate Mimic
text: Whenever you cast a spell that's both red and white, Battlegate Mimic has base power and toughness 4/2 until end of turn and gains first strike until end of turn.
title: Battlegate Mimic

name: Belligerent Hatchling
text:
First strike
Belligerent Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
Whenever you cast a red spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Belligerent Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a white spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Belligerent Hatchling.
title: Belligerent Hatchling

flavor: "When in doubt, kill 'em twice."
name: Double Cleave
text: Target creature gains double strike until end of turn. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
title: Double Cleave

flavor: Some duergars dismiss the world above as a fable. They react violently when their comfortable illusions are dispelled.
name: Duergar Assailant
text: Sacrifice Duergar Assailant: Duergar Assailant deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
title: Duergar Assailant

name: Duergar Hedge-Mage
text:
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Mountains, you may destroy target artifact.
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Plains, you may destroy target enchantment.
title: Duergar Hedge-Mage

flavor: Duergars are prodigious workers with long memories. Some still fulfill intricately detailed orders given decades, if not centuries, before.
name: Duergar Mine-Captain
text: {1}{R/W}, {Q}: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 until end of turn. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)
title: Duergar Mine-Captain

name: Figure of Destiny
text:
{R/W}: Figure of Destiny becomes a Kithkin Spirit with base power and toughness 2/2.
{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}: If Figure of Destiny is a Spirit, it becomes a Kithkin Spirit Warrior with base power and toughness 4/4.
{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}: If Figure of Destiny is a Warrior, it becomes a Kithkin Spirit Warrior Avatar with base power and toughness 8/8, flying, and first strike.
title: Figure of Destiny

flavor: "Make these shots count. The more foes we drop now, the fewer we'll have trying to kill us later."
name: Fire at Will
text: Fire at Will deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target attacking or blocking creatures.
title: Fire at Will

flavor: Hobgoblins are best left alone. They sharpen their farm implements far more than is necessary for their work in the fields.
name: Hearthfire Hobgoblin
text: Double strike
title: Hearthfire Hobgoblin

flavor: The faeries snickered at first. A common hob in Oona's skies? But his lance ended their mockery, and now the sound of a cicada's wings brings a shudder to the faerie heart.
name: Hobgoblin Dragoon
text: Flying, first strike
title: Hobgoblin Dragoon

name: Moonhold
text: Target player can't play land cards this turn if {R} was spent to cast Moonhold and can't play creature cards this turn if {W} was spent to cast it. (Do both if {R}{W} was spent.)
title: Moonhold

flavor:
"A great siege is a banquet to him; a long and terrible battle, the most exquisite delicacy."
—The Seer's Parables
name: Nobilis of War
text:
Flying
Attacking creatures you control get +2/+0.
title: Nobilis of War

flavor: A river even the merrow dare not cross.
name: Rise of the Hobgoblins
text:
When Rise of the Hobgoblins enters the battlefield, you may pay {X}. If you do, put X 1/1 red and white Goblin Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.
{R/W}: Red creatures and white creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn.
title: Rise of the Hobgoblins

name: Scourge of the Nobilis
text:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature is red, it gets +1/+1 and has "{R/W}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
As long as enchanted creature is white, it gets +1/+1 and has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
title: Scourge of the Nobilis

flavor:
"I knew a creature carved from a dream of wild freedom. Any attempt to leash or exploit it failed, and at terrible cost."
—Ashling
name: Spitemare
text: Whenever Spitemare is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to target creature or player.
title: Spitemare

name: Waves of Aggression
text:
Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)
title: Waves of Aggression

flavor: She follows the old tributaries built when merrows still shaped the tides.
name: Cold-Eyed Selkie
text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
Whenever Cold-Eyed Selkie deals combat damage to a player, you may draw that many cards.
title: Cold-Eyed Selkie

flavor: The forest grew fangs. The sky spread its wings.
name: Fable of Wolf and Owl
text:
Whenever you cast a green spell, you may put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, you may put a 1/1 blue Bird creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
title: Fable of Wolf and Owl

flavor: Enlightenment is the mundane seen from the vantage point of the divine.
name: Favor of the Overbeing
text:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature is green, it gets +1/+1 and has vigilance.
As long as enchanted creature is blue, it gets +1/+1 and has flying.
title: Favor of the Overbeing

flavor: Do the glowing trinkets show it the way home, or do they set a twisted path for someone else to follow?
name: Gilder Bairn
text: {2}{G/U}, {Q}: For each counter on target permanent, put another of those counters on that permanent. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)
title: Gilder Bairn

text:
{G/U}, Sacrifice Grazing Kelpie: Put target card from a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)
title: Grazing Kelpie

flavor: Endry was determined to teach his groundlings a few winged-faerie tricks.
name: Groundling Pouncer
text: {G/U}: Groundling Pouncer gets +1/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn and only if an opponent controls a creature with flying.
title: Groundling Pouncer

name: Invert the Skies
text: Creatures your opponents control lose flying until end of turn if {G} was spent to cast Invert the Skies, and creatures you control gain flying until end of turn if {U} was spent to cast it. (Do both if {G}{U} was spent.)
title: Invert the Skies

name: Murkfiend Liege
text:
Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other blue creatures you control get +1/+1.
Untap all green and/or blue creatures you control during each other player's untap step.
title: Murkfiend Liege

flavor:
"She walks among us unseen, learning from our imperfections."
—The Seer's Parables
name: Overbeing of Myth
text:
Overbeing of Myth's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card.

name: Selkie Hedge-Mage
text:
When Selkie Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Forests, you may gain 3 life.
When Selkie Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Islands, you may return target tapped creature to its owner's hand.
title: Selkie Hedge-Mage

flavor: The Aurora replaced the changelings' innocence with malice and their curiosity with hunger.
name: Shorecrasher Mimic
text: Whenever you cast a spell that's both green and blue, Shorecrasher Mimic has base power and toughness 5/3 until end of turn and gains trample until end of turn.
title: Shorecrasher Mimic

flavor: Bogles are very tasty if you can get the skin off. It's getting a blade on them that's the problem.
name: Slippery Bogle
text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

flavor: Losing his possessions distressed him, but the lack of limbs was strangely liberating.
name: Snakeform
text:
Until end of turn, target creature loses all abilities and becomes a green Snake with base power and toughness 1/1.
Draw a card.
title: Snakeform

flavor: Spitting is the customary greeting between a creature and its magical impostor.
name: Spitting Image
text:
Put a token that's a copy of target creature onto the battlefield.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)
title: Spitting Image

name: Sturdy Hatchling
text:
Sturdy Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
{G/U}: Sturdy Hatchling gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Whenever you cast a green spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Sturdy Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Sturdy Hatchling.

flavor: Travelers in these waters leave a bit of themselves behind.
name: Trapjaw Kelpie
text:
Flash
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)
title: Trapjaw Kelpie

flavor: Selkies call to a sea they never swam, in a tongue they never spoke, with a song they never learned.
name: Wistful Selkie
text: When Wistful Selkie enters the battlefield, draw a card.
title: Wistful Selkie

name: Altar Golem
text:
Trample
Altar Golem's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.
Altar Golem doesn't untap during your untap step.
Tap five untapped creatures you control: Untap Altar Golem.

flavor: Every skull has a tale to tell, and a skulkin is many dire tales cobbled together.

text: {2}: Target white creature gains persist until end of turn. (When it dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

flavor:
"Everything falls apart. But living things fall apart in the most fascinating ways."
—Mowagh the Gwyllion
name: Fang Skulkin
text: {2}: Target black creature gains wither until end of turn. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

text: {3}: Target green creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
title: Hoof Skulkin

flavor:
"Ah, skull of shrew—a very potent substance. In powdered form, it gives thrice the zing of noggle hoof pulp."
—Boghald, Barrenton medic
name: Jawbone Skulkin
text: {2}: Target red creature gains haste until end of turn.
title: Jawbone Skulkin

flavor: The banner was not a symbol of victory, but a herald of the carnage to come.
name: Leering Emblem
text:
Whenever you cast a spell, equipped creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Equip {2}
title: Leering Emblem

flavor: Her poppets bring joy to the truly depraved.
name: Scarecrone
text:
{1}, Sacrifice a Scarecrow: Draw a card.
{4}, {T}: Return target artifact creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
title: Scarecrone

flavor: Skulkins confer strange benefits on unsuspecting patrons.
name: Shell Skulkin
text: {3}: Target blue creature gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

flavor: Mages dare not attempt magic in its grotesque presence.

flavor: Travelers bathe in the falls to wash away curses from the pucas who lurk nearby.

text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{U/R}, {T}: Add {U}{U}, {U}{R}, or {R}{R} to your mana pool.

flavor:
"Do not linger in such places, child. There the gwyllions dance. If they find you, you will join in their revels for eternity."
—Talara, elvish safewright
name: Fetid Heath
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{W/B}, {T}: Add {W}{W}, {W}{B}, or {B}{B} to your mana pool.
title: Fetid Heath

flavor: At full moon, the river seeps over its banks and crawls through the woods like a blanket of serpents.
name: Flooded Grove
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{G/U}, {T}: Add {G}{G}, {G}{U}, or {U}{U} to your mana pool.
title: Flooded Grove

flavor: Hobs bury their kin far from home. They believe the dry, open ground keeps hags from stealing the bones and gwyllions from stealing the spirits.
name: Rugged Prairie
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{R/W}, {T}: Add {R}{R}, {R}{W}, or {W}{W} to your mana pool.

text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{4}, {T}: Put a 0/1 white Goat creature token onto the battlefield.
{T}, Sacrifice X Goats: Add X mana of any one color to your mana pool. You gain X life.

flavor: As their roots soaked in a weak tea of bogwater and decay, the trees absorbed the essence of death into their living tissue.
name: Twilight Mire
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{B/G}, {T}: Add {B}{B}, {B}{G}, or {G}{G} to your mana pool.
